Reviews.Title: “Easter 2012, GREAT stay at Palazzo Cardinal Cesi!”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned to USA from our Easter visit to Rome. We chose to stay at Palazzo Cardinal due in part to location and due to previous recommendations from friends. The rooms were nice and comfortable although somewhat small by US standards. The rooms were cleaned every day. There was wireless Internet in the rooms which worked well for the few times we made use of it. There was some night time noise, especially if you are like us and prefer to sleep with a window open. We simply dealt with it. The bathrooms were small, but again no big deal. There was breakfast every morning downstairs and we made the most of that. Most evenings we had a pre-dinner drink in the hotel's bar area. The hotel is set up for a light bar service and they can even cook a small dinner for unplanned situations. This worked perfect for us as there was one evening my parents were too tired to go out for dinner. We knew the location was great and this selection alone was important as we were traveling with my parents including my Dad who was wheel chair bound. In the weeks leading up to our trip, the staff was wonderfully responsive and informative in helping to answer questions and helping us to set up tours and plan day trips. During our five night stay we got to know most of the staff personally. Again the staff were very accommodating, especially towards my Dad. By the time we left we felt like we were saying good-bye to friends. For my parents this was their once in a lifetime trip to Rome and to see the Pope. The hotel and the staff did not disappoint. For my wife and I, we will look forward to coming again someday to spend time with our friends at this excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Literally a block from the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: Seldom is the time I give a hotel an Excellent rating, however this place was pretty much as close to perfect as possible. It is on the main axis leading to St. Peter's and literally a block away. The hotel is an old residence of Cardinal Cesi and maintains much of it's old world charm. The nearest train station is Musei Vaticani a little far, but walkable. We got into the main station (Rome Termini) and took a cab to the hotel. The hotel itself is quite exquisite and you get that feeling as soon as you walk through the double doors. Of course, sometimes they're closed so you have to press the button to get in. The first things you see are the cloister corridors, the splash of colors, and the elegant simple courtyard. The lobby is towards the rear of the courtyard. If you are looking around for a traditional large check-in desk with someone standing around, forget it, not at this place. The lobby feels more like a living room, including a nice wood desk which is where you actually check-in. The gentleman who helped us check-in was very kind, personable, and professional. When we were done with the paperwork he showed us up to our room. Even the corridors are elegantly designed. The rooms are simple but elegant at the same time. The room wasn't as big as some other ones we stayed at before, but everything was plush and so clean you could smell it. The bathrooms were also simple and elegant. It seemed like we were the only ones there until we heard a door slam in the morning the next day. There were a couple of things to enjoy while at the hotel. One was enjoying the courtyard on a warm evening (which it was when we were there) and the breakfast room. The room was large but felt very intimate. The food itself was wonderfully delicious and fulfilling. We were lucky to get a very good price on this place and if we get a chance to go back to Rome, this is the first place we will look to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “At the Doorstep of the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: bkb6060
Reviews.Content: Talk about location! The Palazzo Cardinal Cesi is located on the Via Conciliazione, literally a few steps from St. Peter's Square. You just can't get any closer to the Vatican than this. If you're interested in photography staying here allows you to photograph St. Peter's any time of the day or night. To get the early morning light on the facade just step out of the door when you wake up and aim your camera. Night time photos of the floodlit Basilica are a snap when all you have to do to after a late night photo session is turn around and walk through the door to your hotel. Proximity to St. Peter's is the major advantage, but it's far from the only positive thing about this location. City buses and the step-on tour buses stop directly across the street from the Palazzo, and a just few steps farther down is a taxi stand, making transportation anywhere in the city extremely easy. A subway stop is fairly close as well. A tobacco shop selling all manner of necessities is right next door. The area is VERY safe, and is peaceful and quiet at night, which can't be said for all areas of Rome. These things make the Palazzo a perfect choice for first timers to Rome, although repeat visitors will find a lot to like as well. The Palazzo Cesi is an oasis in a very bustling city. Walking through the door into the serene cloistered courtyard makes the noise of the city seem a million miles away. This pleasant atmosphere is much appreciated after a tiring day of sightseeing. Although the garden is only open to hotel guests during very limited hours, the tranquility it provides is very welcoming. The building itself is historic, having been built in the year 1400. It's now the headquarters of an order of priests and brothers who share the building with the hotel they operate. Since different wings of the building are reserved for each purpose tourists rarely cross paths with the order. While not luxurious rooms at the Palazzo are immaculately clean and more than adequate in every way. The beds are comfortable. The hallways are quiet, we heard no noise from outside or from other guests. When closed, the window blinds completely darken the rooms. Our family group had two rooms, both of which were a nice size. One of the bathrooms was smaller than the other, however, with a fairly small shower stall. If that matters to you maybe it would be wise to request a room with a larger bathroom. Nice toiletries are provided, and the breakfast was very good. While not what I'd describe as warm the staff was none the less helpful at all times. Because our luggage was lost on the flight they recommended moderately priced clothing stores out of the tourist area so we could replace the lost items without busting our budget. Due to scheduling issues it was necessary for us to change the dates of our reservation after they'd been made. The Palazzo was professional and helpful in dealing with these changes. Email questions were promptly and thoroughly answered. This is a wonderful establishment, and a perfect place to stay in Rome. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: tskada
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my parents when I was living in Rome. I chose it based on the reviews on tripadvisor and the close proximity to my apartment. The location is perfect and the small rooms are nicely decorated so the size wasn't an issue for them. Customer service was however disappointing, they did not let me go to their rooms to pick them up in the morning or after dinner to chat before saying goodnight, internet was not working, and my parents were not very excited by the boring breakfast. After the first night, we changed hotels because the staff were not very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “EXTRAORDINARY HOSPITALITY”
Reviews.Author: JeanneM714
Reviews.Content: The location, staff, hospitality and breakfast cuisine were outstanding. I was at this hotel in October when a severe and rare rainstorm hit the area. Also, my luggage failed to arrived during the duration of my stay.The staff was attentive to every detail of my needs...without my asking. Service and security were incredible.

Reviews.Title: “across plaza from st peter's”
Reviews.Author: active 15
Reviews.Content: for openers, this old school hotel is directly across the street from st peter's plaza. you enter through a grand ole courtyard with palms, running water and statues. the cheerful english speaking staff is most helpful including their printing out airline boarding passes. rooms are decent size with in-room wireless computers. warmed towel ranks were a delight. and water was near instantly hot and hotter! breakfast was a full as you could want, incl scrambled eggs and cooked meats. across the street was the 'hop-on-hop off' bus for sightseeing all of rome with one or three-day passes. been cesi before; now been back; will come again. active 15

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls between rooms and floors, noisy street!!”
Reviews.Author: Mintler
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind sleeping at night, then this may be the place for you...between listening to the garbage pick-up at 2am, honking cars, and literally listening the the conversation in the room next door, because the wall are SO thin, we didn't have a restful night at all. Location is ok if you like tourist infested experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and serene. Steps to vatican”
Reviews.Author: ladywithceliacs
Reviews.Content: Lovely inner courtyard. Not a bad size room but as usual the small shower didn,t please my husband. Quiet back street which our window overlooked. Helpful staff. Helped us with tour bookings and restaurant suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “Seventy steps from the Vatican Square!”
Reviews.Author: servok
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 delightful nights. Breakfasts were excellent. Nice but small bar located outside with limited food menu. Rooms were excellent with great maid service. Staff excellent. Very quiet neighborhood after 8 pm. Walk out the front door and you are 70 steps from the Vatican!

Reviews.Title: “4 day trip”
Reviews.Author: worboyssandra
Reviews.Content: location was perfect .Walking into the hotel was like walking into a secret garden with a beautiful courtyard and was a beautiful place for peace and quiet from the hustle and bustle outside. staff were great very courteous .Room was fine only downside was the shower too small . but this is only a minor detail. Breakfast fine and overall we had a great stay at this wonderful hotel right beside the vatican and within walking distance of many Rome attractions. would love to return sometime

Reviews.Title: “Overstated”
Reviews.Author: Jan B
Reviews.Content: Over priced for what we got, breakfast was nothing special and the stickily floor at the breakfast bsr was off putting

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: JenGP
Reviews.Content: Location - perfect. Right next to St Peter's Square, it's a 5 min walk from 2 bus stations, about 10-15 mins away is the St Angelo Castle. It's right in the middle of a very busy neighborhood but you'll be surprised at how tranquil it is inside the hotel. The taxi stand is also almost right next to the hotel so our taxi arrived 3 mins after the receptionist called the taxi company. Staff - for the price we paid, we didn't expect the high level of customer service that we got. We were treated like VIPs the minute we entered, with people from the reception fussing and making sure we knew where we were going, giving tips on what's good to see in the city, discreetly tucking our luggage into our room, helping us book for tours. You feel generally safe in their hands, so to speak. Room - tiny, but as expected for the price and for European standards. Bathroom is also small but adequate, with daily supply of towels and the usual small bottles of toiletries. The only downside was that our window was right next to a construction site, so it was a little noisy in the morning and early evening.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect location for Vatican, Piazza Navone”
Reviews.Author: bertnils
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days after cruise. Came from Civitavecchi, got off at train station San Pietro ,10 min walk down hill. Very nice staff,. Very Good Breakfast. Quiet garden where you can relax and have a glass of wine. Outside busy street. Almost on St Peters Square. Vatican museum and Caste St Angelo very close, and 10 min Walk to Piazza Navone. Tour buses directly on street outside hotel. Excellent Value for price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice cosy hotel, great location near the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: RuwAnil
Reviews.Content: Wonderful customer service and clean accommodations with all the standard amenities you'd need. Good spread for breakfast as well. Rooms are a bit small but I think that's par for the course in Rome. Step outside the door and you're in St Peter's Square - but when you're in the hotel you'd never know it because it is so quiet (used to be an old monestary). Colloseum is a leisurely 40min walk and the Pantheon is about 20mins. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Penny_11809
Reviews.Content: This was our first of 5 hotels in Italy...perfect pick. Thank you former travelers. The location was great. It was next to the Vatican with a short walk to great places to eat. The staff was wonderful. The service was great from reception to checkout. The room, though not big by US standards, had ample room. It was clean with the luxury I was hoping for. Thank you Palazzo for making our first stay in Rome great!! If we ever return, we will not hesiatate to stay again!!! Thank you for the wonderful champange and flowers...a perfect start to a wonderful honeymoon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: MissKathryn
Reviews.Content: Beautiful cloisters and courtyard garden but no residents lounge, restaurant, services or facilities ie. beauty room. We had a standard room which was small, bed was hard and the walls so thin we could hear the entire telephone conversation of the occupant next door and that of the gentleman she was on the phone to! Bathroom was small and had no bath, shower only had a curtain, the wall seat was broken and the basin wasn't securely fixed to the wall.We felt it was very expensive for what was effectively only bed and breakfast. We had expected a hotel at the very least and from its title and price, something rather more palatial.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bgtny
Reviews.Content: Location and hotel service was very good. You are only 100 meters from St Peters. Great location the local city tour buses are right outside the front door. The buffet breakfast fresh with good selection. The front desk staff very friendly and very helpful. The only negative is the bathroom. I have traveled throughout out Europe and I must say these are the smallest bathrooms I have ever experienced. The shower stall measures about 2 feet by 2 feet square with 2 accordion style doors, no bathtubs. Positive note water pressure is good and hot.. The atmosphere and quite courtyard make it a very nice retreat after a hard day of site seeing. Overall excellent hotel just be aware of the bathrooms

Reviews.Title: “Childless weekend away”
Reviews.Author: mattevans73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, it is a few steps from the Vatican and only a few minutes walk from many other areas of Rome. The interior of the hotel is very clean and tidy with a lovely courtyard that is shady and quiet. The room was very small but perfectly functional. The bathroom was even smaller and the shower cubicle was very tight. The breakfast buffet was well stocked and very tasty. On the down side our room smelled of smoke and the extractor fan did not work which was a little annoying. Also the hotel was quite noisy. Although you could not hear the street outside you could hear other guests in their rooms at all times of the day and night. I would recommend staying at this hotel because it is in a good location with very friendly and helpful staff with clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: Paul-SArlington
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nites in April 2011. I was very excited to get a room here at a good rate, based upon the reviews. The good: The staff was very nice. Special thanks to Augustino who works the late shift who helped me book a last minute tour to Florence. We requested a corner room on a lower floor, and got both. This was tremendously helpful since I am claustrophobic and would not get on the very small elevator. Also, this corner room had two windows, which made it feel bigger. The bed was also perfect. It is the only real king size bed that I have ever slept in in Europe. And it was comfortable. The location is remarkably good. For us, just about perfect. Being that close to St. Peter’s is really great. One of my biggest concerns was that there might not be any restaurants in the area. There was no need to worry since there are actually many. And they are just a couple of blocks away. The best, by far in my opinion, was Tre Pupazzi, Borgo Pio 183. There is also a very good gelato shop just across the street there. There are five tourist bus stops directly across the street from the hotel. This is great for checking out the town, but definitely not a substitute for getting around town (as I thought) since they do not run frequently enough and are quite slow getting from one side of town to the other. Also, none of the comments I read mentioned the souvenir shops. It was great to have so many souvenir shops right in the immediate area. The Bad: We had room #206. The internet did not work. The light next to the bed did not work. The room was not entirely clean (specifically the toilet seat lid and floor around the toilet). We could find only one English language channel, the BBC. Noise: We had a neighbor who snored every night. It was just loud enough to annoy you. We could hear a conversation – clearly enough that I could tell it was a British woman. One night, we had a full audio performance of a female during “extracurricular activities”. It actually woke me up. The bathroom was the biggest issue. Having read the reviews, I did not expect a big bathroom, and I knew the shower was small. What I did not realize was just how small the shower was – until I got there. How small was it? Well, I had to stop the shower and open the sliding doors just to bend over to wash my lower legs. It was tiny. Also, the toilet was so close to the wall that I had to sit at an angle. If you are above average size, or older, you might want to take this into consideration. Overall, if I were returning to Rome, I’m not sure I would stay at this hotel again, mainly because of the bathroom. If not the Vatican area, I would likely stay in the Piazza Navona area, which is fantastic but not as busy or popular as areas like the Spanish Steps. Piazza Navona is actually only about a 15 minute stroll across the bridge. The city itself is very beautiful and very crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: Jeliya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the third building down from St. Peter's, on the right. You can't really get much closer than that. It is wonderful to be able to step out the door and into St. Peters Square and the Vatican complex. The real bonus is to do so before breakfast, no wait at security and be in St. Peters at 8 am when it's quiet and there are no tour groups (you might even have the Pieta all to yourself) have the run of the place for a few hours, and still catch breakfast. Even though the street outside can be manic and noisy, once you step through the doors and into the courtyard it is instantly calm and cool. The hotel itself is modest, there are few facilities, it does breakfast and you can have drinks in the courtyard, but then, you have come to Rome so you will spend most of your time out sightseeing, strolling, shopping and going to restaurants. The rooms are modest in size, clean and comfortable, bathroom is small, and that's about it. As long as you know what you are getting, you won't be disappointed. Service is helpful and friendly, and there is a sense of tranquility about the place. Breakfast is buffet, reasonable selection. Some guidebooks suggest that it is a bit out of the way, I didn't think so. Piazza del Popolo, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Pantheon are all 15-20 minutes walk away, but it helps to study the map and pick which bridge to cross. The walk actually makes it more enjoyable, you pass a lot on the way, especially if you use the smaller streets in the centre rather than main ones with the traffic on them. Bus route 64 links it to Piazza Venezia and Termini Station, so that helps if you want to get to the other side of the city quickly. If you are arriving from Fuimicino Airport, the coach to Termini station stops at Piazza Cavour first, which is less than 10 minutes walk from the hotel (just head for St. Peters). While most of the good places to eat are across the river, there are also good places nearby. Avoid the tourist traps near the Vatican - at all costs, never eat into any place that has a waiter outside hussling business. Two good spots about 4 blocks away are Da Toscano on Via Germanico (good Tuscan food, great steaks, nice setting) and Ragna D'Oro on Via Silla (more local food, informal but pleasant setting). The hotel staff can give you directions.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Duncampin
Reviews.Content: Step outside and you're right in front of St Peter's. Feels like it's part of the Vatican. Warm room on cold February nights. Quiet. Good breakfast. Helpful staff. To be picky , the (free) internet was slow.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and truly magical stay”
Reviews.Author: katie_holiday
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay in the Cardinal Cesi and can vouch for the fact say that it was absolutely amazing! The hotel was literally a few steps away from the Vatican and could not have been better placed to explore both the Vatican museums and the rest of historic Rome. The hotel is on the main road leading up to the majestic St Peters Basilica and is awe inspiring. We felt really privileged to stay in such a place and the ancient building really fitted into what we dreamed for our visit to Rome. We are used to staying in nice hotels but this was something else for us, the Cesi's amazing location and calming courtyard were a wonderful retreat after a hard days walking. The rooms were quite small, but were perfectly formed and definitely worth it for the fantastic location. The smuggest part was escaping the heaving crowds at the vatican to nip back (2 seconds away) to our gorgeous hotel for a wee and a glass of ice cold wine!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DrGuinness
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here on a few-day trip in Rome for business and a bit of sight-seeing on my time off. The hotel is set back in an old palace-style, with an inner courtyard. The outer gate is locked at night, and you need a room key to get in, so it's very secure. The staff were helpful on arrival, and showed me to my room. The room was spacious enough as standard - had a double bed, desk with TV, small wardrobe with safe and a bathroom with shower, toilet/bidet and basin. The room was clean and the amenities were acceptable and provided me with all I could need during my stay. The location, to say the least, was magnificent. Step out the front gate, and 20 steps to your left and you're in St Peter's Square. Also, a 20-minute stroll into the heart of Rome, and 5-10 minute walk to the Ottaviano Metro station, or the St Peter's train station. Plenty of cafés and restaurants around. I do, however, have some criticisms of the hotel. The room itself was fine. The bathroom was adequate, however the shower was a bit too small for a man of my size (6ft) and I had trouble in it. Anyone of a smaller stature would have no issue. The shower had a bit of soap scum left on the soap rack, which was a little off-putting. During the first evening, what seemed to be an extraction fan or similar kept clicking on and off at random intervals, and I was unable to find any switch to turn it off in the room. I checked with reception the next morning, and they advised next time it turned itself on, to call down to them and they'd turn it off from their mainframe system. The curtains would not shut properly, so I was unable to completely block out the sun, and had to dash across the room lest I be seen in an immodest state from street-level. The sound of water rushing down the pipes either from others' showers or toilet flushing was rather loud in the room, and occasionally woke me at night. In addition to this, I could hear the people in the next room talking through the wall, but not loud enough to hear the content of their conversation. Having said all this, it was an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: KMBrickl
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, impeccable service, gorgeous room, delicious breakfast, peace and tranquility yards from the Vatican - what more could you want on your Honeymoon? The Palazzo Cardinal Cesi was romantic, convenient, luxurious - all at a great price. This is by far the best value, location, service, and amenities in Rome. I recommend this hotel to ANYBODY traveling in the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in S. Pietro”
Reviews.Author: JWJ1981
Reviews.Content: Only steps from S. Pietro, this hotel is absolutely gorgeous. The rooms are clean and modern. The building is an old palace. The hotel has WIFI. The breakfast is more than adequate. And, above all else, the service is perfect. I have no hesitation in reccomending Cesi... I've stayed there several times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice - chique hotel at superb location”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Peter_23
Reviews.Content: Absolutely to be recommended for its location, quality and superb service. The hotel is located practically at St Peter's Square. Charming inner garden. Hotel and room were very clean; excellent bed. Since the rooms are on the rear side of the building, there is hardly any traffic noise - which is special in Rome. Very professional and very friendly staff, always ready to assist. We will definitely choose this hotel again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “classy ++”
Reviews.Author: active 15
Reviews.Content: stayed four nights 18-21 nov during busy vatican time. cesi has everything...location, courtyard, first class comfort and full breakfast. wi-fi and on-line computer in your room. i echo the other great salutes. active 15

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Jules099
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for visiting the Vatican and St Peters Basilica. Also the open top tour buses go from right outside the door. The Hotel was like and oasis once you got throught the main door the noise seemed to disappear.. The staff, rooms and breakfast were excellent. Only slight problem was the noise from the refuse collecters in the middle of the night but that happens the world over. Brilliant location went to St Peters at 7.15 am then went back for breakfast what queue at that time!!! Also seriously recommend booking the Vatican museum tour on the official website for the earliest slot to avoid the very very long queues, we did the 8.30am slot and walked straight in. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Holy Land”
Reviews.Author: Escossia
Reviews.Content: A charming small hotel, centrally located. We stayed only 3 nights in this elegant hotel. The staffs provide excellent service as well. The location is unsurpassed and walking distance of Vatican City. Excellent photos! Everyone in the Hotel was extremely helpful and also really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest find in Roman hotels”
Reviews.Author: mfo
Reviews.Content: We found the Cardinal Cesi through numerous comments on Tripadvisor, and it proved to be one of the greatest hotel finds of our travel lives. Very friendly staff, open to suggestions and helping with area directions. Totaly free, easy internet to check on family, very accessible to all Roman attractions, and a beautiful view from the front of the Vatican. Plus a relaxing outdoor "lobby" for end of the day cocktails. And with a free, significant breakfast. A daily prayer delivered to your door in the morning was a nice touch. This was the greatest find in Roman hotels. Thanks!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BDBoyle
Reviews.Content: With its front door ~100 meters to the center of St. Peter's Square, the location alone is enough to recommend the hotel. The hotel is also a five minute walk to two different bus stops and a subway stop (the bus stops are great, as the available bus lines go straight to the Coleseum, passing almost all the main sites along the way). The hotel is very elegant, with its arched portico entry way and its beautiful courtyard with tables and bar service. The bar prices are a bit expensive, but if you order the 6 euro glass of red wine, you get a topped off glass that is really like getting two normal glasses. The rooms are small but well-appointed, perfectly adequate for two people. The showers are tight, but also not a huge deal. We found the staff very helpful, as they explained the bs lines to us and made several dinner reservations for us at resaurants we picked out on TripAdvisor. A great location, a nice room, and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, beautiful hotel, staff horrible!”
Reviews.Author: Moojie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the best location right next to the Vatican and in front of the tourist bus station. The hotel was very small, beautifully presented and extremely clean. The room was spacious with lovely high ceilings and free internet access. The man who checked us in was very friendly but the friendliness ended there! When I asked for an expresso at breakfast the waitress huffed and puffed before walking off. This only encouraged me to ask for another!!! That afternoon I bought a bottle of wine from outside the hotel and the lady at the bar in the hotel would not give me a wine glass because I did not buy the wine from her (at 5 times the price!!!).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, very peaceful”
Reviews.Author: bucketlistshr
Reviews.Content: This place is right outside of the vatican, a few blocks south of the metro and even closer to the bus line. abundant cabs, and near the river. Breakfast included and it is hearty. service is great. The only downside is that it is too quiet at times. Not for those who desire a more lively atmosphere, but convenient for those who wish to fully experience the vatican. In the room internet via the television was a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “In the shadow of St Peters”
Reviews.Author: intrepidtravellers44
Reviews.Content: The title of this review says it all: you are located 100m from the entrance to St Peters square. This alone might be enough to convince some yet this boutique hotel has much more to offer: the courtyard garden is a delight for both escaping the drama of Rome and for a considered beverage, the staff are fantastically helpful and friendly, the free wi fi helps in planning your days and the breakfasts are of good standard. The rooms are comfortable, the bathrooms small (a bit like showering in a sleeping bag was how we heard one guest describe it) but overall for what we paid and where it was it was exactly what we wanted!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, small, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: LuckyCountry15
Reviews.Content: This is a truely beautiful hotel. From the moment you walk through the doorway, you feel relaxed and the stunning courtyard is a true oasis from the heat and bustle of Rome. The location is perfect...just outside the main square of Vatican City. There are hop on ,hop off buses across the road but we walked to all the major sites. The hotel is small (30 rooms) but it is set back from the road so you do not hear any street noise or traffic at night. The staff are fantastic. They could not do enough for us as we had only booked their hotel about 30minutes before arriving late in the afternoon. All the staff speak good english, were friendly & really remembered their guests. The rooms are not huge but there was still plenty of room & we were staying for 5 days. The bathroom is small,especially the shower, but we didn't think this was abig deal considering how long you spend in a shower each day! If you are a light sleeper, ask for aroom on the 5th floor, at the end as you can hear your neighbours above, and the water running in the next room. (This is an old building so that is to be expected) There are electronic shutters on the windows, which keeps the room dark if you like to sleep late. They have free wifi from a lovely little study area near the breakfast room..we were able to use skype & use our laptop at any time in this quiet area. The breakfast was enjoyable and they open their bar area in the courtyard from 4pm each day...it is the perfect place to sit & enjoy a wine, beer or cappacino and unwind after aday of sightseeing. Just beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: JOrenstein
Reviews.Content: Elegant, modern, top-grade hotel. Great breakfast. Literally steps from the Vatican; it's practically in St. Peter's Square. Only minor point: small shower, but serviceable.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the Eternal City”
Reviews.Author: 7piranda
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, 1 minute walk to the San Pietro Basilica. The building itself is a piece of art especially the interior garden. Rooms small,but very clean, decorated in a classic, elegant manner. Bathrooms too small, about 2 sq meters. Very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful retreat in a busy place close to the Vatican.”
Reviews.Author: Kay098
Reviews.Content: The staff at Palazzo Cardinal Cesi were very kind and helpful. After the busy, crowded atmosphere of the Vatican Square, this is the place to rest. When you walk through the doors of the hotel, you are transformed by a peaceful garden courtyard. The rooms are small, but VERY clean and nice. Just steps away from the Vatican, this is the place to stay if you are visiting that area. We just loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Just a few steps from the Pope”
Reviews.Author: zazzo67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a few steps from San Pietro. It is a very old building (1400) renewed so rooms are small but clean and with anything you need. Breakfast is very good. People is very friendly. There is no parking but in Rome the best thing is not to use a car because traffic is heavy and no places to park. Just in front of the hotel there is the bus stop for tourist (we used Roma Cristiana the yellow one and it is good). The only thing i didn't like was the noise from the street

Reviews.Title: “Staying at the Gates of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: reyesda1
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 7 nights. Very convenient location. Hop on Hop off is across the street and the Vatican is a 3 minute walk. The staff is professional and friendly. On the last day, we had to check out 4 AM. Front Desk staff took care of the paperwork and while waiting for our ride to Fuimiciano, made me an espresso and a cafe Americano for my wife with a couple of croissants. The garden bar staff were more of the same, friendly and professional. If you're tired and want to stay in and want a simple meal, they serve lasagna, rigattoni, and sandwiches. We had dinner there twice. If you want to be very, very close to the Vatican, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful oasis”
Reviews.Author: chris49
Reviews.Content: Step inside the main door of this hotel and you are in an oasis of calm and peace. Check in dealt with speedily and my suitcase and I whisked up to my room on the 5th floor. Beautifully clean room, wonderfully comfortable bed - I slept like a log every night. Small bathroom, but everything there that you could need. Breakfast very good. There was a hot selection, or rolls, ham, cheese, yoghurts, cereal, etc.etc. everything for every taste. For the first four mornings, breakfast was refectory style, no backs towards other people! The last morning, tables were turned and we sat more normally. The location is superb - walking up to the hotel at the end of the day AND having St Peter's right in front of you was a sight not to be forgotten. Don't expect a view, though. Because there is a courtyard behind the main front door, the hotel lies towards the back, with views over the road at the back. If I leaned out of my window, I could just see the dome of St Peter's!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location right beside the vatican.”
Reviews.Author: ruairidhScotland
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have just returned from a wonderful weekend in rome staying at the Palazzo Cardinal Cesi. I spent hours looking for a hotel with a great location and we were not disappointed. We landed in Rome about 7pm and jumped straight into a white cab outside the airport. Didnt take too long, about 40 minutes, but this was in heavy traffic. We arrived at the hotel and couldnt believe how close we were to St peters square. the hotel is so close the square you wouldnt believe it. When entering the hotel there are large doors and you step into an open garden walkway which takes you to the reception. The rooms are very clean, not huge in size but comfy beds and quiet. Breakfast is great, a lovely selection and the staff are very helpful. First day we walked straight out onto the square and within minutes were stopped by a tour guide asking if we wanted to go with a tour group to see the Sistine Chapel and Vatican Muesems. At first we werent sure but please dont be put off...the tour was £80 euro total but so worth it. The tour guide was an american called Steve and so great. we bypassed all the queues and what a tour.!! well worth it. took a few hours and ended in St Peters Church...words cant describe how amazing it is!!...we ate that night in a lovely family run restaurant just past the archway beside the vatican walls called Borgh Bio..just fab and so friendly! a real family run place.!! fab food!...we walked the next day to the Trevi Fountain and Pantheon and Colleseum, walk didnt take long, 20 mins from hotel...busy but great, but glad we stayed near the vatican and not in the centre, so lovely to get back to the vatican at night and relax and unwind and wonder round the square after dinner. St peters is beautiful lit up at night!....be prepared for alot of walking. If you want a great hotel, right beside the vatican and dont want the buzz at night of outside bars this is the place to stay. ohhhh and we were lucky enough to see the Pope sunday at midday and we wouldnt have known this if it wasnt for our tour guide. Walks of Rome was the name of the tour i think!!...would love to go back one day and we would defo stay at the Palazzo Cardinal Cesi again!....only thing to mention was no tea/coffee facilities in the room. We didnt have dinner here but i think you could ask , all reviews for dinner said the food was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “So close to the Vatican that you can almost smell what the Pope is cooking for dinner!”
Reviews.Author: claire_morrissey08
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel - the location is amazing, the staff are friendly and attentive (plus the men that work there are good looking! bonus points!) the room was clean, and I thought relatively spacious given the location. The breakfast is fantastic; even though they advertise it as basic it is much more than that. Plus the breakfast room is not a typical 'restaurant' room - it has a great feel to it. The internet access was fantastic. We stayed for 4 nights; and would happily stay there again. Don't let the front door put you off; its strange as you do not walk straight in (well until they give you swipe card access once checked in, anyway). - it feels extremely secure. The staff could not help us enough with tourist information etc. Would DEFINITELY stay again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel at buzzling rome-vatican”
Reviews.Author: NoelChieroTemon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for one night only. It is easy to find because if you can find basilica st peter, then you may locate this hotel. my first impression on the door gate was bit doubtful, because it doesn't look like hotel entrance for me. passed the corridor to view the stunning winter garden. was bit confused whereabout the receptionist since there is no clear sign of it, and the hotel. (palazzo cardinal cessi shares the same entrance with kind of monastery, i think) my doubt was ease with warm welcome from the receptionist. though i arrived bit earlier for check-in time, the room was already prepared for me. great service!! the receptionist also spent some times to explain the hotel facilities, including opening time of bar, breakfast area, and the internet/laptop point. the room was fantastic although bit small. it was a single room with single bed and tiny shower room. I expected bigger room. However, the room itself was really great. the single bed was comfortable and the window overlooked nice neighbour buildings. I have no complaint at all with breakfast. the breakfast room is breathtaking, with unusual table/chair arrangement. you will feel like in the king arthur dining room. :) in my opinion, the food quality was great, and not to forget fresh coffee and tea (slices of lemon were nice addition to my liking) Just an advice, if you are thinking to take express train from airport to termini station, then take taxi from there to the hotel, it would be better to take taxi directly from airport. it cost more or less the same. and the great thing is, the receptionist will be gladly to arrange the taxi for you, but you must insist for the local taxi, not their limousine. the local taxi will cost you 40eur and hotel's limousine is 60eur.

Reviews.Title: “fall break”
Reviews.Author: ikkenatuurlijk
Reviews.Content: not cheap, but worth the money, very friendly staff, ideal location for vatican

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location. Unbeatable price.”
Reviews.Author: DPD_Chicago
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my first visit to Rome, where I stayed at the Cardinal Cesi. As other reviewers have noted, it is incredibly close to St. Peter's -- in fact, I believe the only building between the Cardinal Cesi and St. Peter's square is a building housing offices for the Vatican. The hotel itself was very clean. The courtyard off of the entrance was spectacular. The room, as other reviews have noted, was monastery - like (which was appropriate for the trip), but the bed was extremely comfortable (along the lines of a Four Seasons-style mattress). I booked through Tripadvisor (ultimately through Booking.com) and received a rate of 98 euros / night. As I said, it was my first trip to Rome, but in Paris, 98 euros / night would get you something far, far short of the Cardinal Cesi. Overall, a tremendous value, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, and close to the Vatican.”
Reviews.Author: USParisian
Reviews.Content: My parents, my husband and I stayed three nights at the Palazzo Cardinal Cesi. The staff was very kind and helpful (band-aides, taxis, restaurant recommendations). The location was great - we could not have been ANY closer to the Vatican. The room was very clean with great AC and bathrooms. A little on the small side, but given the price and cleanliness I can't complain. The breakfast each morning was nice too (included in price). Would definitely revisit and recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A haven of peace and tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Egremontonian
Reviews.Content: If you after a glitzy and glamorous hotel then this is not for you. This is a charming haven of peace and tranquility for those who wish to be close to St Peters. We booked a deluxe room for 4 nights. We had heard that the rooms were small but whilst not large it was not cramped. The bathroom was small and only had a shower, which is fine for us but some people might like a bath. The bed was very comfortable and when we asked for more pillows they arrived promptly. There was ample storage space and electric shutters on the windows afforded privacy. The standards of cleanliness were outstanding, the bed linen and towles were changed daily. Breakfast afforded lots of choice, my partner particularly liked the fact that there was a wide range of teas and pots to brew them in, unlike many continental hotels it was therefore possible to make a decent cup of tea. The hot items were limited to scrambled eggs and pancetta but both were of a good standard. Some people have criticised the layout of the breakfast room but given the shape and size of the room we could not see any other way they could do it, in any case we didn't find anything wrong with the layout. We discovered the delights of the small cafe overlooking the courtyard garden on our first evening as we were rather tired from having taken an early flight. During our stay this was run by Zara who took orders, made drinks and organised the light meals on offer on the small menu. Her service was outstanding. She was always cheerful and nothing was too much trouble. We used the cafe several times and were never disapointed. Other restaurents were a ten minute walk away as everything close by closed for the evening. Not a problem for those who like an evening stroll. The courtyard belongs to the Savatorian monastry which is why hotel visitors have no access to it, you can however sit and admire it from the cafe, it is especially atmospheric when candlelit in the evening. Location is hard to make a judgement on, for closeness to St Peters and the Vatican then it would be almost impossible to beat, however it is not so convenient for the historic centre. That said buses run from nearby to those areas and anyone who enjoys using Shank's pony would be able to stroll across the river and into the centre without any difficulty. The hop on hop off tour buses also all have a major stop opposite the hotel. The hotel reception staff were courteous and efficient, on our last day we had to leave prior to the normal breakfast serving time but they arranged a slightly early breakfast for us, this was very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly quiet retreat in Rome”
Reviews.Author: mrslind
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel, based on Trip Advisor Reviews, for my husband and mother in law to stay at on their trip to Rome. I wanted something close to the Vatican because they were arriving late Saturday Night and attending Palm Sunday Mass at the Vatican early the next morning. I also arranged their airport transportation through the hotel. They were overly impressed with all aspects of the hotel, especially the location. St Peter's was only a few steps away. When they arrived at the airport, a guy was waiting in a mercedes with their name on a sign and took them right to the hotel. The place was very quiet, and had a beautiful courtyard. They said it was definitely not a place to be if you want any sort of nightlife, but was perfect for their purposes. The rooms were small of course, compared to American standards, but not at all compared to many other hotels we have stayed at in Rome. The hotel is actually a monestary that rents out a certain number of rooms. Everything was clean, the staff was helpful, there was a computer in the lobby with free internet access, and a light breakfast was provided each morning. The staff recommended a nearby restaurant which turned out to be a diamond in the rough, and they had an amazing meal there.

Reviews.Title: “For Vaticanists!”
Reviews.Author: OLOL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem for those who love to spend time in St Peters. I will return and return and return. Rooms are small but pristine - in a location like this you only want to sleep and spend you day outside in the Vatican and Rome. For those who love the Dvine Mercy Saint Faustina and Perpetual Adoration a church dedicated to the Divine Mercy and Saint Faustina is just around the corner. Thi is a gem close to the Vatican and the staff are very pleasant,

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: teaforgirls
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Palazzo Cardinal Cesi on Sept. 23-Sept.27 for our 15th anniversary. This is a lovely place. The location is fabulous- with St. Peter's Basillica outside your doorstep, the taxi stand across the street and every hop on hop off bus in town making stops across the street the location can't be beat. The world outside the front door was busy touristy Rome, but once you step through the massive front door you step into a calm peaceful environment. The staff was helpful. The breakfast was good. The room was clean. Do not let the prices detour you. I contacted the hotel to see if there was a better price than was being shown on their web page. Since we were staying for several nights the hotel was able to offer us a reasonable price that made it possible for us to stay here. (It never hurts to call/email and ask.) The only negative I have about our stay is that there was significant noise between each room; but I would take the noise to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Beat”
Reviews.Author: ruar
Reviews.Content: I booked this 'hotel' instead of where my uncle & aunt were staying on the other side of Castel St. Angelo b/c it was cheaper and in the best area. Don't be scared by the average price shown, I played with dates on their website and a single was as low as 85EUR. (I paid 170EUR) Except for their sister 'hotel', you couldn't find a better Vatican location. It is a very safe area, even for a female alone like me. The very large exterior doors are closed at night but just buzz reception, they'll take a look at you on the small camera and open the automatic doors for you, to get out push the button on the inside. Inside the doors is a beautiful calm oasis. Reception is straight ahead and just to the right (looks like someone's office). There's a small bar area that seems to be quite popular. An elevator past that takes you upstairs or take the marble staircase. Just past the elevator is the breakfast room on the left which looks like monks are expected for a meal, and a small lounge with a computer with internet access. I had a single room which had no room for a crib/cot but was a nice size for just me and baby. There was a safe, fridge w/ honor bar, slippers, remote TV, phone, luggage rack, plug for internet and electric blinds to block out sun. Might have been more things like an iron and bathrobe, but I didn't notice. The double paned windows kept out any noise. The bathroom was a very nice looking marble. On closer inspection it was the fake marble but a very good one. There was a shower and enough space to put toiletries. The room was deliciously chilled when I went into it and I actually turned down the A/C fan. The bed was comfortable but I was tired. Buttons for the lights and to control the blinds and the internet plug are on the headboard. Breakfast was coffee & teas, pastries such as chocolate croissants, ham, cheese and other cold cuts, and probably cereals and juices. I was in a hurry and didn't have time to try everything. They do not discourage children, they have a cot/crib and there was another couple with a small child there. I am not sure it would be good for older children, like my 3 and 6 year old. Noise in the halls would carry and they can't really run around too much. The atmosphere is too quiet and they have the courtyard cordoned off. From what I gathered it is a headquarters of the Salvatorians. Part of the building seems to be used solely for religious purposes. The paper slipped under my door in the morning was not a bill but a list of bible readings for the day. There are materials in the rooms of a religious nature as well. If this bothers you, it might not be the place for you. I think it was recently opened to guests and everything seems new and of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Palazzo Cardinal Cesi”
Reviews.Author: Cruisingat60
Reviews.Content: In late May, a group of 12 "old friends" (we graduated from high school together over 44 years ago!) booked a Princess cruise that left from Civitavecchia on May 26th. We decided to add a little adventure to our trip by flying to Rome two days earlier and seeing the sights on our own. Luckily we found the web site for the Palazzo Cardinal Cesi and they had rooms for all of us! (Only 30 rooms are available as it is still an active monastery). Not only were the rooms quiet, comfortable & fabulous, but the people who work at the hotel are all fantastic! Franz, especially was awesome! Not only did he see to our every need during our stay, but he also helped as our unofficial tour guide booking Vatican tickets and making sure we understood the open air bus routes...plus he located some lost luggage at the airport! Every morning we were treated to a delicious Italian buffet breakfast that was out of this world with variety. Everything about this hotel is 5 star plus! You'll love the location, too as it's just yards away from St. Peter's Square! We highly recommend the Palazzo Cardinal Cesi! Sincerely, Judy, Gary & fellow travelers

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: ImpJac
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night, the hotel was very nice, beautiful courtyard to sit and have a drink or pot of tea. Location is excellent for the Vatican, we even saw the Pope on the Wednesday. Room had everything you needed except for tea making facilities which were really needed after a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A Cardinal's house next door to the Vatican!!!”
Reviews.Author: benoit908
Reviews.Content: Right next door to the Vatican City it is ideally situated if the Vatican is your main focus for the trip. The courtyard/lobby is the best I have ever experienced but, a common theme with Italy and indeed most European cities, the room was small. Right outside the hotel is are about 6 tour bus stops so take your pick of bus and see the whole of Rome or stroll 100 yards up the road to see the Sistine Chapel, Basilica Church and the museums etc. Our tour cost 130 euros for both of us (pre booked)and even picked us up at the hotel for the 30 second drive to the museum. The bonus of doing it this way is you miss the 4 hour queue and have a guide per about 6 tourists who explains things you may have missed such is the layout and lack of plaques and info etc. They say rome wasn't built in a day but if you exclude the Vatican, it can be toured in a day if you start early enough. We saw all the sights and chose the 15 euro hop on, hop off tour bus deal enabling us to get off and walk to different sights that you can't get to by bus (such as the Spanish Steps and the Pantheon). Beautiful hotel. Our room was a standard as the were no deluxe available. it has 30 rooms and only 4 deluxe. All rooms have a shower only and those wanting a bath in their room has to book at their sister hotel down the road (which is not as nice). All rooms have electric shutters which block out all noise (not much in this part of town anyway) and all light. Our standard was tiny but adequate. It cost 255 euros per night which again, is expensive but worth it to save the commute to get into Rome. There is no parking but they have a deal with an underground garage nearby who allow you to park there at a discounted rate of 20 euros per day. We used it for one day with no problems. The breakfast room is excellent and food was good. The courtyard is available from 1600 to sit and have a drink but again is expensive. My wife seemed a little too comfortable to chill out there sipping her way through vodka and oranges at 7.50 euros a piece. It is an idylic setting in the courtyard. You are metres from the hussle and bustle of Rome yet it is so tranquil. The main door at the front is shared between the hotel, the pilgrimage and some sort of Cardinal's group. There are lots of choirs singing and it is lovely. There are also tombs of ancient priests etc there. I was disappointed not to have got a deluxe room and asked to see one on our last day so I could compare. I must say, it was about 1 metre wider and about 50 euros a night more expensive so definately not worth it. The only real bonus is you don't have a comically small shower room in the deluxe. All in all a lovely hotel in the heart of Rome a literal stones throw from St Peter's Sq. Staff are great and, apart from the usual room size issue, it is faultless. I apologise in advance. I forgot to take pics of the room. close your eyes, picture a double bed and a tiny shower room and you'll be spot on. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “all rooms face the rear street - don't select delux room”
Reviews.Author: ottopuhlman
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this property (March 24-25, 2008). Upon check-in we were told that they were giving us a quiet room facing via Santo Spirito (the back side of the hotel) because the rooms are quieter as opposed to facing the front as shown on all the advertisements. Later I found out that all rooms face the back of the back of the hotel and that there are no rooms facing the front. All the rooms at this property are small. We paid for a delux room. We returned around midnight from a late dinner, we discovered the shower would not drain. I called the front desk to advise and they were not receptive to move us to another room. They suggested that we take shorter showers, however the drain was completely plugged. This drain problem should have been discovered when the room was cleaned before we arrived. We really wanted to take a shower and after strongly pressing this issue we were finally given a key to another room to use the shower. You can read other reviews on this site for shower size. The other room was a single but decorated the same as our delux room. The next morning when I returned the key I inquired if there had been previously problems with the plumbing and was advised that the drain stops up when you wash your hair. We had looked in other rooms during our stay and all the rooms look like a delux rooms. Don't pay the extra for a delux room. Upon check-out I brought up the fact that we had problems with our shower and the inconvience that this caused. Having paid for a delux room, I thought a working shower was part of the package. I was sternly advised that I was not going to be charged for using the other room that could not be sold that night because it had to be cleaned after we used the shower. Needless to say this matter could have been handled in a more professional matter, either by price adjustment or a simple apology would have done the trick. This hotel's location to the Vatican would be the top selling point in my opinion. While many hotels in Rome are costly, the price paid for this hotel for what is provided in room type, size and ammenity should be judged with staying at a further location and saving the difference in cab fare or simply walking and enjoying Rome on the way to St. Peter's. REMEMBER YOU WILL NOT HAVE A ROOM FACING THE VATICAN AT THIS HOTEL AS SUGGESTED IN THEIR ADVERTISEMENT. You will share the front entry with a very kind Nigerian with an interesting selection or Prada Purses. The courtyard is also shared by others and is not exclusive to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cesi very good.”
Reviews.Author: perritoHUND
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent one night at the Cesi. We loved it! The location was perfect and the staff was very nice. The rooms were very clean and the breakfast buffet was better than expected. What really surprised me was how friendly the staff was! It made the whole "Roma" experience better for my wife. From here we went to the Hilton Cavalieri Hotel (on the hill) and, I can honestly tell you, we wished we had stayed longer at the Cesi! For the price, location, and experience, the Cesi beat the Hilton, without a doubt. The only plus side for the Hilton is that they had an indoor pool. But that is about it.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Splendour”
Reviews.Author: LondonTamarac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palazzo Cardinal Cesi for a two night break. We found the whole place enchanting and the location could not have been better. We took a tour of the city which was booked for us from the front desk of the hotel and it could not have been easier. We enjoyed the location and above all felt very welcomed by the hotel staff and felt very safe when walking around at night. I cannot wait to return to the same hotel, perhaps later on in the year. J. Ferrari London England

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: julesmk
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from the the palazzo cardinal cesi in rome, this hotel was excellent, staff were friendly polite and helpful. the location is perfect for st peters square and there is a great cafe/bar opposite, perfect for a glass of wine and people watching. we asked the hotel to book us a taxi for the airport, there is a standard charge of 30 euros but when we arrived at ciampino the driver charged us 60 euros, the hotel had arranged their car to take us but didnt inform us of that. this may have been a misunderstanding but we felt disapointed that this had happened apart from that we had a brilliant time in rome and will return to this hotel without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “a very good one”
Reviews.Author: bistvan
Reviews.Content: it was a short trip with me miss in rome. only two days. but, the hotel was excellent. the location is just perfect. a few steps to reach the st. paul cathedral and like a ten minutes to reach the downtown. we really liked the atmosphere of this hotel. as far as we find out originally it was built for a clergyman (i think it's cardinal cesi) and it's still there somehow, but in a good way. old stones, old furnitures (but in really good condition), old style furnitures in the rooms, clean bath, clean rooms, clean hotel. the staff was really helpful (and a bit noble-like), good food and a really-really lovely inner garden! overall, it's absolutely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bobbie5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cardinal Cesi for 4 nights while on a pilgrimage tour of Italy. What a lovely place to stay! The location can't be beat: mere steps away from St. Peter's Square, with taxis in abundance to take you elsewhere in Rome at reasonable prices. The staff was friendly, efficient, professional, and helpful; the main areas of the hotel, especially the courtyard, were lovely; my room was spacious and comfortable and kept very clean; and the breakfasts provided were plentiful and delicious. I highly recommend this hotel, especially for travelers wishing to be near the Vatican.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sturmans
Reviews.Content: we stayed from 9 till 11 march 2007 in this hotel,we really love it. the location is splendid,hotel is great,in the garden on the terrace drinking a cappucino,what more do U want? The rooms are Ok. We are frequently visitors from Rome,but this was the nicest hotel we did ever stayed. We are coming back!!! Gr M.Sturmans

Reviews.Title: “Looks are deceiving”
Reviews.Author: SallyPCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This hotel was truly awful. My husband and I were booked at the Paulo VI, but because the hotel 'lost' our reservation (?!), they stuck us here (their "sister" hotel) by default. While the semi-tranquil garden and location were all great, the hotel itself and room were absolutely terrible. Not only does the place feel like an a convent or seminary (which wasn't too surprising given its proximity to the Vatican), but every moment we spent on the premises (less than 2 hours) was downright creepy. The rooms were miniscule (think prison cell), dirty (old soap left in the bathroom), the receptionist was utterly bizarre (and clad in a grey morning suit with tails and top hat) and forget anyone over five feet trying to fit in the shower. I assume if one plans on spending every waking moment in and around the Vatican (it's directly across the street from St. Peter's and thisclose to Roman peddlers), then the "Cesi" may be your cup of hostel tea. But if you want a quiet, relaxing, sanitary, and pleasant experience in Roma, stay far, far, away from this dump. We checked out almost immediately upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LeedsAway
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not be any nearer to St Peters. Hidden off the busy streets behind heavy doors lies a small peaceful hotel with central courtyard. The shower probably is the smallest I have used but the room itself was clean and comfortable. It even had elecric shutters to keep out the morning sun. Breakfasts adequate. Only downside is it is about 10mins walk from tube stop. Would definately recommend it to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time here”
Reviews.Author: OCScouse
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in the 3rd week of september for the first leg of our honeymoon. We had 4 nights. The room was clean and was nicely furnished. We only had 3 problems with the room. 1. It was small, but I guess that is to be expected in most European hotels. 2. The shower was TINY. It was a 4x4 box that made it impossible to move while in the shower. 3. The bed was VERY hard. I think most Euro hotels go with the firm mattress, but that makes it tough to sleep if you are used to a nice soft one at home. Every other aspect of the hotel was top class. The staff was VERY helpful. They all spoke English and were willing to help us out with directions or recomendations. Franz was very charming and helpful. We LOVED the breakfast. It was relaxing and charming. The location was great. You step outside into St. Peter's Square. We would stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Palazzo Cardinal Cesi
HotelInfo.Address: Via della Conciliazione n.51, 00193 Rome, Italy
